main event: Multiple unidentified objects were sighted in the sky in Mescalero, New Mexico, on May 17, 1955, with reports ranging from 20 to 40 objects observed over a 15 minute duration.
interesting points: Objects were reported to be moving in a straight course and appeared as bright silver specks,The sighting included radar tracking confirming visual observations,No physical evidence was found,One observer reported the object was approximately 2 feet in diameter with a red bottom and white top,The sighting coincided with weather conditions that were described as clear and good visibility.
witness description: A gas station attendant from Apache Summit with previous sightings of strange objects.
